Package org.neo4j.internal.unsafe

Class UnsafeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.internal.unsafe.UnsafeUtil
  • public final class UnsafeUtil
extends Object
    Always check that the Unsafe utilities are available with the assertHasUnsafe() method, before calling any of the other methods.

    Avoid `import static` for these individual methods. Always qualify method usages with `UnsafeUtil` so use sites show up in code greps.

    • Field Detail

      • PRINT_REFLECTION_EXCEPTIONS

        private static final boolean PRINT_REFLECTION_EXCEPTIONS

      • DIRTY_MEMORY

        private static final boolean DIRTY_MEMORY
        Whether or not to explicitly dirty the allocated memory. This is off by default. The allocateMemory(long, MemoryTracker) method is not guaranteed to allocate zeroed out memory, but might often do so by pure chance.

        Enabling this feature will make sure that the allocated memory is full of random data, such that we can test and verify that our code does not assume that memory is clean when allocated.

      • getAndAddInt

        public static int getAndAddInt​(Object obj,
                               long offset,
                               int delta)
        Atomically add the given delta to the int field, and return its previous value.

        This has the memory visibility semantics of a volatile read followed by a volatile write.

      • getAndAddLong

        public static long getAndAddLong​(Object obj,
                                 long offset,
                                 long delta)
        Atomically add the given delta to the long field, and return its previous value.

        This has the memory visibility semantics of a volatile read followed by a volatile write.

      • compareAndSwapLong

        public static boolean compareAndSwapLong​(Object obj,
                                         long offset,
                                         long expected,
                                         long update)
        Atomically compare the current value of the given long field with the expected value, and if they are the equal, set the field to the updated value and return true. Otherwise return false.

        If this method returns true, then it has the memory visibility semantics of a volatile read followed by a volatile write.

      • compareAndSwapInt

        public static boolean compareAndSwapInt​(Object obj,
                                        long offset,
                                        int expected,
                                        int update)
        Atomically compare the current value of the given int field with the expected value, and if they are the equal, set the field to the updated value and return true. Otherwise return false.

        If this method returns true, then it has the memory visibility semantics of a volatile read followed by a volatile write.

      • compareAndSwapObject

        public static boolean compareAndSwapObject​(Object obj,
                                           long offset,
                                           Object expected,
                                           Object update)
        Same as compareAndSwapLong, but for object references.

      • allocateMemory

        public static long allocateMemory​(long bytes,
                                  MemoryTracker memoryTracker)
                           throws NativeMemoryAllocationRefusedError
        Allocate a block of memory of the given size in bytes, and return a pointer to that memory.

        The memory is aligned such that it can be used for any data type. The memory is uninitialised, so it may contain random garbage, or it may not.

        Returns:
        a pointer to the allocated memory
        Throws:
        NativeMemoryAllocationRefusedError

      • free

        public static void free​(long pointer,
                        long bytes,
                        MemoryTracker memoryTracker)
        Free the memory that was allocated with allocateMemory(long, org.neo4j.memory.MemoryTracker) and update memory allocation tracker accordingly.

                              long destOffset,
                              long bytes)
        Same as copyMemory(long, long, long), but with an object-relative addressing mode, where null object bases imply that the offset is an absolute address.

      • newDirectByteBuffer

        public static ByteBuffer newDirectByteBuffer​(long addr,
                                             int cap)
                                      throws Exception
        Create a new DirectByteBuffer that wraps the given address and has the given capacity.

        The ByteBuffer does NOT create a Cleaner, or otherwise register the pointer for freeing.

        Throws:
        Exception

      • initDirectByteBuffer

        public static void initDirectByteBuffer​(ByteBuffer dbb,
                                        long addr,
                                        int cap)
        Initialize (simulate calling the constructor of) the given DirectByteBuffer.

      • getDirectByteBufferAddress

        public static long getDirectByteBufferAddress​(ByteBuffer dbb)
        Read the value of the address field in the (assumed to be) DirectByteBuffer.

        NOTE: calling this method on a non-direct ByteBuffer is undefined behaviour.

        Parameters:
        dbb - The direct byte buffer to read the address field from.
        Returns:
        The native memory address in the given direct byte buffer.

      • exchangeNativeAccessCheckEnabled

        public static boolean exchangeNativeAccessCheckEnabled​(boolean newSetting)
        Change if native access checking is enabled by setting it to the given new setting, and returning the old setting.

        This is only useful for speeding up tests when you have a lot of them, and they access native memory a lot. This does not disable the recording of memory allocations or frees.

        Remember to restore the old value so other tests in the same JVM get the benefit of native access checks.

        The changing of this setting is completely unsynchronized, so you have to order this modification before and after the tests that you want to run without native access checks.

        Parameters:
        newSetting - The new setting.
        Returns:
        the previous value of this setting.

      • getShortByteWiseLittleEndian

        public static short getShortByteWiseLittleEndian​(long p)
        Gets a short at memory address p by reading byte for byte, instead of the whole value in one go. This can be useful, even necessary in some scenarios where allowUnalignedMemoryAccess is false and p isn't aligned properly. Values read with this method should have been previously put using putShortByteWiseLittleEndian(long, short).
        Parameters:
        p - address pointer to start reading at.
        Returns:
        the read value, which was read byte for byte.

      • getIntByteWiseLittleEndian

        public static int getIntByteWiseLittleEndian​(long p)
        Gets a int at memory address p by reading byte for byte, instead of the whole value in one go. This can be useful, even necessary in some scenarios where allowUnalignedMemoryAccess is false and p isn't aligned properly. Values read with this method should have been previously put using putIntByteWiseLittleEndian(long, int).
        Parameters:
        p - address pointer to start reading at.
        Returns:
        the read value, which was read byte for byte.

      • getLongByteWiseLittleEndian

        public static long getLongByteWiseLittleEndian​(long p)
        Gets a long at memory address p by reading byte for byte, instead of the whole value in one go. This can be useful, even necessary in some scenarios where allowUnalignedMemoryAccess is false and p isn't aligned properly. Values read with this method should have been previously put using putLongByteWiseLittleEndian(long, long).
        Parameters:
        p - address pointer to start reading at.
        Returns:
        the read value, which was read byte for byte.

      • putShortByteWiseLittleEndian

        public static void putShortByteWiseLittleEndian​(long p,
                                                short value)
        Puts a short at memory address p by writing byte for byte, instead of the whole value in one go. This can be useful, even necessary in some scenarios where allowUnalignedMemoryAccess is false and p isn't aligned properly. Values written with this method should be read using getShortByteWiseLittleEndian(long).
        Parameters:
        p - address pointer to start writing at.
        value - value to write byte for byte.

      • putIntByteWiseLittleEndian

        public static void putIntByteWiseLittleEndian​(long p,
                                              int value)
        Puts a int at memory address p by writing byte for byte, instead of the whole value in one go. This can be useful, even necessary in some scenarios where allowUnalignedMemoryAccess is false and p isn't aligned properly. Values written with this method should be read using getIntByteWiseLittleEndian(long).
        Parameters:
        p - address pointer to start writing at.
        value - value to write byte for byte.

      • putLongByteWiseLittleEndian

        public static void putLongByteWiseLittleEndian​(long p,
                                               long value)
        Puts a long at memory address p by writing byte for byte, instead of the whole value in one go. This can be useful, even necessary in some scenarios where allowUnalignedMemoryAccess is false and p isn't aligned properly. Values written with this method should be read using getShortByteWiseLittleEndian(long).
        Parameters:
        p - address pointer to start writing at.
        value - value to write byte for byte.

      • defineAnonymousClass

        public static Class<?> defineAnonymousClass​(Class<?> host,
                                            ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Define a class but do not make it known to the class loader or system dictionary.
        Parameters:
        host - the host class
        byteBuffer - the code to load
        Returns:
        the defined class
